title: Practice Topics
description:
Explain Hashtag and its role in Social media. How the Hashtag(# Tag) been used in Social media for false marketing?
Elaborate on issues and challenges in cyber security system.
Zero Day and Zero Click Attack with example.
Federal Information Security Management Framework Recommended by NIST
International Standards Organization (ISO) best-practice areas.

Explain the trapdoor functionality of Elliptic Curve Cryptography.
Demonstrate the Key exchange using Elliptic Curve Cryptography.
Explain the working of Encryption and Decryption using Elliptic curve cryptography.

Using the doubling and Addition functions in Elliptic Curve {Y^2 mod 11 = X^3 + 2X + 1 mod 11}. Find 3P given G( )

title: Practice Questions
description:
What is the use of Hash? Explain the process of
hash generated in SHA-2.

Explain working of DES Algorithm. What is S-Box?
How is S-Box used in the DES Encryption?

ECDSA Signature and its Verification.

Elliptic Curve Cryptography and its Trapdoor Function.

Example of Addition and Doubling Functions in EC.

The three modes of Network Intrusion Detection System (NIDS).

What is Cyber Space? Explain the architecture involved?

The federal information security management framework recommended by the National Institute of Standards and Technology(NIST).

Roles and responsibility of personnel presented in the Security Management System.

Process of identifying potential malicious attacks on the firewalls.

How Security is implemented for the Listed Layers in Networks:
i) Transport Layer
ii) Network / Internet Layer

The seven guidelines given by NIST for disaster recovery and backup.

title: Just for practice:
description:
Pig Latin :  (Challenge - less than 32 LOC) 

Pig Latin is a language constructed by transforming English words. While the origins of the language are unknown, it is mentioned in at least two documents from the nineteenth century, suggesting that it has existed for more than 100 years. 
The following rules are used to translate English into Pig Latin: 
• If the word begins with a consonant (including y), then all letters at the beginning of the word, up to the first vowel (excluding y), are removed and then added to the end of the word, followed by ay. For example, computer becomes omputercay and think becomes inkthay.
• If the word begins with a vowel (not including y), then way is added to the end of the word. For example, algorithm becomes algorithmway and office becomes officeway.
Write a program that reads a line of text from the user. Then your program should translate the line into Pig Latin and display the result. Validate  - the string entered by the user only contains lowercase letters and spaces.

[Q4] With respect to your project domain - Design and develop a web page with

SCRIPTING code snippet in the web page related to your domain project. It must

consist the following:

(i) Demonstrate various data types in JAVA Script related to project domain
(ii) Implement JAVA Script Functions
(iii) Demonstrate Object

title: Final Report Submission and Future scope and further enhancement of the Project.
Draft Report preparation and Correction by Guide

System Security measures (Implementation of security for the project developed)
•Database/data security
•Creation of User profiles and access rights
•Cost Estimation of the Project along with Cost Estimation Model
•Reports (sample layouts should be placed)

SYSTEM TESTING PHASE

●	Testing the system as a whole after integrating the subsystems
●	Evaluation of project by Guide [Feedback].

Test Cases document for each screen (not less than 10 pages) should be submitted.

Coding and Implementation
•	Coding
•	Complete Project Coding
•	Comments and Description of Coding segments
•	Standardization of the coding
•	Code Efficiency
•	Error handling
•	Parameters calling/passing
•	Validation checks

Specify Algorithms, related data structures if required

Complete Design Document of at least 15 pages should be submitted at the end.

User Interface Design
•
description:
Interface between the subsystems/modules
•    Interface between user and system

title: SYSTEM DESIGN PHASE
description:
System models:
•    Block diagram can be given for the system as a whole
•    DFD / ER Diagram to model how the data is processed in the system. [Context level DFD]

title: WT program related project Domai n-Program-3
description:
WEEK 03
------------------------------
[Q3] With repsect to your project domain - Design and develop a web page with

Cascading style sheet in the web page related to your domain project. It must

consist the following:

(i)  Inline and Internal CSS
(ii) CSS Fonts

(iv)  CSS image background

title: WT Related Project Domain-Program -2
description:
WEEK 02
-----------------------------
[Q2] With respect to your project domain - Design and develop a web page which

consist the following parameters or specification :

(i)  Develop a webpage which demonstrate usage of Images in HTML document - An

image height and width using attributes, AN image map with clickable regions

and a floating image.

(ii) Demonstrate tables in HTML document with borders, cell padding, headings,

caption, alignment etc..

(iii) Consider various lists in HTML document such as ordered and unordered

lists with respect to domain information.

title: Software Requirement Phase
description:

•           Project
Study – Existing System, Limitations of existing system, Proposed System,

title: WT LAB PROGRAM 1
description:
WEEK 01
-----------------------------
[Q1] With respect to your project domain - Design and develop a static web page

which consist the following parameters or specification :

(i)   Develop at least three different web pages - which consist your domain

information.
(ii)  Include at least 3 Headings , 3 Paragraphs with all formatting options

such as Bold, Italic , Underline etc.,
(iii) Consider the Different color for heading and background if required.
(iv)  Demonstrate hyperlinks to navigate between pages.

title: Lab Test 3
description:
Develop an application for a "Courier/Package Management System."

a) Use at least 10 Controls with proper code (20 Marks)
( Dragging and Dropping of Controls will not be considered as tool usage)
b) Complexity (10 Marks)
c) Proper Documentation (your Submission) (5 Marks)
d) Creativity (5 Marks)
Submission should contain the following:
1.List of 10 Controls with code (you have used)
2.Code & Screenshots 
3.List the extra thing you did for complexity

form.title: Choose your domain for .NET Lab Exercises

title: CIA3_ComponentB_Assignment
description:
Strictly follow the instructions given below.
Submit your assignments in A4-sized unruled sheets only. Proper presentation should be there. Sheets should be neat and clean and the use of margins is necessary. The assignment should be stapled alongside the left margin rather than stapling it on the corner.
Write your name and register number on the top right corner of every facing sheet. 
Submit both soft copy and hard copy of the assignment. Make sure that the scanned copy is submitted properly and is readable. 
Submit the assignment on or before the prescribed date and time.
Write on both sides of the paper.
If any of the above requirements are not met, marks will be reduced accordingly.

title: Question Paper Practice 4
description:
As you failed to follow the rules and regulations of Question Paper Practice 2,  you are in need to write all the questions with answers 2 times. You won't be allowed to enter the class without submitting this in time. Strictly follow the rules given below.
Write the answers together with the questions 2 times. Answer all the questions. There shouldn't be any mistakes in this.
Write your name and register number on the top right corner of all the sheets you are writing.

title: Question Paper Practice 2
description:
This is an assignment for practicing the questions of the CIA1_ComponentB_Descriptive Test.
Write the answers together with the questions 1 time. Answer all the questions. There shouldn't be any mistakes in this.
Write your name and register number on the top right corner of all the sheets you are writing.
Hard copy should be submitted before 10:05 AM.
